misconceptions.student_thought_process: The student believes that their implementation of the shift loop (lines 20-22) is fully correct and that the purpose of the problem description was merely to perform a simple right circular shift, leading to the intended logic being correct.
misconceptions.conceptual_gap: The student has successfully implemented the required algorithm for a right circular array shift. They correctly save the last element, iterate backwards (N-1 down to 1), shifting elements one position right, and finally place the saved last element at index 0. There is no conceptual gap regarding the array execution model; the code works exactly as intended and produces the correct output for the sample case.
